critique: The document is an executive order focused on implementing Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, ensuring non-discrimination against individuals with disabilities in programs receiving federal financial assistance. It centralizes coordination and standard-setting with the Secretary of Health, Education, and Welfare, while empowering federal agencies to enforce compliance. The order emphasizes voluntary compliance but allows for suspension or termination of funding in cases of non-compliance, following due process. It promotes social inclusion and expands federal oversight to protect the rights of the handicapped.
